tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Malcolm Milne, a renowned medical researcher and educator. Milne made significant contributions to the fields of renal medicine, electrolyte balance, and amino acid metabolism. He played a crucial role in building up the Department of Medicine at Westminster Medical School and was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1978. His life and work are celebrated in this detailed account of his career and scientific achievements.
